name: Topcoder Project Service - Mask invitation emails
description:
Mask emails of invited users with asterisks for non-admins.

Project Background

Topcoder Project Service is the main backend service of Topcode Connect – the client-facing application of Topcoder. We have the ability to invite members to projects by email. As all project members can see who is invited they also can see emails of all invited users. As email is private information we would like to hide it for non-admin users when we return it by Project Service.

Technology Stack

  • Node.js

Code access

The work for this challenge has to be done in one repository:
- Project Service repo https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service branch dev commit 78b969f521507df8e83635a8e4aa7cb98379a263 or later.

- Config for local setup is provided on the forum.

Individual requirements

  • We have the next endpoints which can return the list of invites for projects or a single invite:
    - `GET /v4/projects` - list of projects with list of invites
    - `GET /v4/projects/db` - list of projects with list of invites
    - `GET /v4/projects/:projectId(\\d+)` - one project with list of invites
    - `GET /v4/projects/:projectId(\\d+)/members/invites` - list of invites
    - `POST /v4/projects/:projectId(\\d+)/members/invite` - single invite
    - `PUT /v4/projects/:projectId(\\d+)/members/invite` - single invite

  • If these endpoints are called by non-admin user in the response we should mask `email` properties inside invites with asterisks so email like `abcdefgh@aaaaaaaa.com` should be returned by endpoints like `ab*****h@aa*****a.com`.

Implementation requirements

  • Create a reusable method `util.maskInviteEmails(inviteJsonPath, data, req)` which we can use to wrap around a response in any of these endpoints like this: https://monosnap.com/file/6xONzkz9qWwqQAlFQRTPwzaD0fDpqf.
    - inviteJsonPath - is a jsonpath inside data. We should use JOSNPath to find object invites inside `data` to apply masking logic to them. So for the endpoint  `GET /v4/projects` it would be something like `$..invites[*]`, for `GET /v4/projects/:projectId(\\d+)` something like `$.invites[*]`, and for `GET /v4/projects/:projectId(\\d+)/members/invites`  like `$`. The “jsonpath”s provided here may be incorrect, this is to give you an idea of what we want to achieve here. So we should be able to reuse this method in the future with different JSON Path if we want. You may add npm package jsonpath, I guess it has a method for applying functions to the objects specified by JSON Path.
    - data - the data which contains invites to process
    - req - Express request object which we can use for checking if the user who made the request has admin permissions or no

  • To check if the user has admin permission, reuse existent method: `util.hasPermission({ topcoderRoles: ADMIN_ROLES }, req.authUser)`

  • Put the logic of masking email in a separate reusable method `util.maskEmail(email)`. It should mask emails like this https://monosnap.com/file/4LSbEKNBCzNs9lNeqWzzxHYykBQWEl. You can use the next algorithm for reference https://stackoverflow.com/a/45944844 which gives such an output. If we pass non-email string to this method - return the same value which we pass.

General requirements

  • Write unit tests for method  `util.maskEmail(email)`, test all the cases from this screenshot https://monosnap.com/file/4LSbEKNBCzNs9lNeqWzzxHYykBQWEl. Also, at least 2 test cases when we pass non-string (null) or non-email string values.

  • Write unit tests for method `util.maskInviteEmails(inviteJsonPath, data, req)`. At least 4 tests:
    - “should mask emails when passing data like for a project list endpoint for non-admin user”
    - “should mask emails when passing data like for a project details endpoint for non-admin user”
    - “should mask emails when passing data like for a single invite endpoint for non-admin user”
    - “should NOT mask emails when passing data like for a single invite endpoint for admin user”

  • Existent unit tests should pass.

  • Lint should pass.

  • Git patch should be without errors or warnings.

If you have any questions or concerns, don’t hesitate to ask on the forum.



Final Submission Guidelines

Submit a zip file which would include:

  • Git patch with changes you’ve made to the code in our repository.

Additionally, the winner would be required to raise a pull request to the repository after the challenge is completed.

name: Topcoder Connect - Project Team - Update Data Source
description:
Update the source of data of user details for the project members and invited users.

Project Background

Topcode Connect is a client-facing application of Topcoder. Each project has a list of team members and invited users, see a project example and screenshot (avatars with arrows are invited users). 

The current logic to show these lists works like this: we load project data which contains the list of members and invites which looks like this for invites. After that, we are loading additional details about project members and invited users to show this list UI. Also, these additional details about project members and invites we use not only to display them in the team section but also to show them for post authors or upload files/links authors.

The current API which returns additional data doesn’t return all the data which we will need for the future changes in UI. So for project members and invites, we want to use other API endpoints for getting details.

Technology Stack

  • React

Code access

The work for this challenge has to be done in one repository:

- Connect App repo https://github.com/appirio-tech/connect-app dev branch, commit 86ee17c46a5695d2bb8e35a3a1bff0672124cf09 or later.

- A user for testing is provided on the forum.

Individual requirements

  • For project members and invites users, we should stop calling “loadMembers” in loadDashboard action, but still, call it for other cases if any.

  • Instead of that, we should load additional data for project members using endpoint  “GET ${PROJECTS_API_URL}/v4/projects/${projectId}/members/?fields=id%2CuserId%2Crole%2CisPrimary%2CdeletedAt%2CcreatedAt%2CupdatedAt%2CdeletedBy%2CcreatedBy%2CupdatedBy%2Chandle%2CfirstName%2ClastName%2CphotoURL%2CworkingHoursStart%2CworkingHoursEnd%2CtimeZone”. It would return all the data we need to render new project members UI in the future and data to show the current UI.

  • And for invited users, we should use endpoint “GET ${PROJECTS_API_URL}/v4/projects/${projectId}/members/invites/?fields=id%2CprojectId%2CuserId%2Cemail%2Crole%2Cstatus%2CcreatedAt%2CupdatedAt%2CcreatedBy%2CupdatedBy%2Chandle%2CfirstName%2ClastName%2CphotoURL”.
    Both these endpoints are returning the same data which we get during project loading, but with additional fields like `handle`, `firstName`, `lastName`, `photoURL` and others.

  • Some users may join a project directly which would lead to adding a new member on the fly. For example, user “pshah_manager” can join any project as a Manager. In such a case, a new member is added to the project. To show this new member we are currently also requesting additional data using loadMember action. We should replace with requesting data from the endpoint  `GET ${PROJECTS_API_URL}/v4/projects/${projectId}/members/${memberId}?fields=id%2CuserId%2Crole%2CisPrimary%2CdeletedAt%2CcreatedAt%2CupdatedAt%2CdeletedBy%2CcreatedBy%2CupdatedBy%2Chandle%2CfirstName%2ClastName%2CphotoURL%2CworkingHoursStart%2CworkingHoursEnd%2CtimeZone`

  • We expect, that after making these changes nothing would be visually changed and all the functionality would work as before.

Implementation requirements

  • To load data from 3 endpoints above create respective actions with constants and api method:
    - action “loadProjectMembers” with 4 constants “LOAD_PROJECT_MEMBERS_*” and API method “getProjectMembers”
    - action “loadProjectMemberInvites” with 4 constants “LOAD_PROJECT_MEMBER_INVITES_*” and API method “getProjectMemberInvites”
    - action “loadProjectMember” with 4 constants “LOAD_PROJECT_MEMBER_*” and API method “getProjectMember”

  • All of these actions should update the list of members or invites in the project redux store in `projectState.project.members` and `projectState.project.invites`. Note, that we already have these lists as we got them when the project has been loaded, but we update them with new data, as this data has some additional properties.

  • Make sure, that if we update the project by making some changes in Scope the updated members list and invites list stay with additional data and are not reset by project updating request (this actually should already work like this).

  • Existent action “loadMembers” keeps its data in Redux store “members.members”. As we don’t call it anymore for members and invites but all the rest of the code gets data from there, so we should put data there too when we call our new actions. But as new endpoints might return much more data, we should only put the next fields which get from them: `userId`, `handle`, `firstName`, `lastName`, `photoURL` to keep the existent structure of “members.members”.

General requirements

  • Follow React and Redux best practices.

  • Follow the DRY principle.

  • Lint should pass (don’t disable eslint rules).

  • Existent unit tests should pass.

Verification

  • Make sure that for project members and invited users we no longer call `/v3/members/_search/` endpoint and calling new endpoints of project service.

  • The data from these endpoints should be put into 2 places in Redux store:  “members.members” to support showing user detail in all the existent places across the Connect App and to “projectState.project.members/invites” so we could use it later in the new UI.

  • Visually for users, nothing should change so far and work as before.

If you have any questions or concerns, don’t hesitate to raise a question on the forum.



Final Submission Guidelines

Submit a zip file which would include:

  • Git patch with changes you’ve made to the code in our repository.

Additionally, the winner would be required to raise a pull request to the repository after the challenge is completed.

name: Topcoder Project Processor ES - Populate User Details
description:
Populate user details of the project members before indexing them in the Elastic Search.

Project Background

Topcoder Project Service is the main backend service of Topcode Connect – the client-facing application of Topcoder. We have done a big update to the Project Service from V4 to V5. In the V5 we moved out functionality for indexing data in Elastic Search to a separate service called project-processor-es. Now we would like to move one more small detail from V4 implementation to V5.

Technology Stack

Code access

Individual requirements

  • In the Project Service V4 before adding project members to the Elastic Search index we populated some additional details about a member, which we get from the Topcoder Member Service, see the code in V4. In short: for a new member which we add to the project member list we first retrieve additional data using `util.getMemberDetailsByUserIds` and after add some fields to the member record. We are using these fields for searching projects in Elastic Search using this additional data.

  • We have to implement the same logic for populating new member with additional data inside V5. This code for indexing members is now in a separate repo here.

  • As method `getMemberDetailsByUserIds` would require setting environment variables like AUTH0_CLIENT_ID, AUTH0_CLIENT_SECRET, AUTH0_URL, AUTH0_AUDIENCE, AUTH0_PROXY_SERVER_URL update README to reflect this fact.

name: Topcoder Connect - Project Team - Update UI
description:
Update project team UI.

Project Background

Topcode Connect is a client-facing application of Topcoder. Each project has a list of team members and invited users as lists of avatars, see a project example and screenshot. As we want to show more information about project members we would like to update UI as per the new design with more details.

Technology Stack

  • React

  • SCSS

Code access

The work for this challenge has to be done in one repository:

- Connect App repo https://github.com/appirio-tech/connect-app feature/member-list-redesign branch, commit 479ef6fec3e4e5d223947adac96e588303fe94a5 or later.

- Users for testing are provided on the forum.

Individual requirements

1. Update data source

  • Currently, to show the list of members and invited users with tooltips (screenshot) we are using data from the Redux Store in `members.members`. As we are going to update UI and show more data, we should use another place to get data for this place: `projectState.project.members` and `projectState.project.invites`. So update code to show members and invites with tooltips (screenshot) by ONLY using data from `projectState.project.members` and `projectState.project.invites` and don’t use `members.members` anymore. A new place has all the data we are showing now plus more, which we will use in the second part.
    - In particular, we don’t have to populate invites with member data anymore, as we already have it inside the invites list now https://github.com/appirio-tech/connect-app/blob/dev/src/projects/detail/containers/TeamManagementContainer.jsx#L157-L162 - so remove this code.
    - also, when we are showing members and invites in popup dialogs which could be opened by clicking “manage invitations” or “manage” links https://monosnap.com/file/rqRI6Wd0DC1sFGVUTf2RzCXbFlvPfg we also should use data from `projectState.project.members` and `projectState.project.invites` instead of `member.members`.

  • Currently, for users invited by emails, we only show email. As now we may get more information inside `projectState.project.invites` for invited users we should all the data we have for them, not only email. If have the only email, then we still show the only email.

2. Update UI

  • We have a new design for project members and invited users provided as a Marvel File. Though not all of the changes we should implement.

  • Keep the same Tooltip which we have now (screenshot) when we hover on the users just add one more line with working hours and user local time as per this screenshot.
    - to show the local user time use `timeZone` value. To calculate the actual time from timeZone you may use this list https://github.com/appirio-tech/react-components/blob/feature/connectv2/constants/timezones.js#L1 which can help you to know the time shift for each of the timezone. We already include a package `react-components` as a dependency. Also, we already have `moment` library which could help to calculate the time. So don’t have to add new libraries to implement this feature.

  • Currently, we show a list of photos. As per the new design, we should additionally show:
    - user full name (fallback to `handle` if `firstName` and `fullName` are not provided for a user)
    - working hours line (like “WH: 8 am – 4 pm EST”)
    - local time (like SUN/MOON icon + “Local time: 10:00 am”)
    see screenshot.

  • Show the SUN icon if it’s currently a working hour of the member, and show the MOON icon otherwise. For now, use the next files for SUN and MOON icons.

  • Don’t show local time if no  `timeZone` is provided for the user. Also, don’t show working hours if `workingHourStart`/`workingHourEnd` are not provided.

  • Always show invites after members (it suppose to be already this way).

  • If there are more than 3 members + invites in one section, show only 3 first by default and show the button “Show All”. Clicking this button should show all the members and invites, and the button should become “Show Less”. Clicking “Show Less” should show only the first 3 records again.
    - don’t implement a new design for the “Show All/Less” button. Use the same style as we have for “+ Manage Invitations” button, but without “+” icon.

  • For invited users, we should still show an “arrow” on top of the user photo as it’s done now.

  • Ignore other changes in UI. Don’t add “mail” icon, don’t change other buttons or anything else.

Other existent functionality should not get broken after such changes. In particular inviting new users, accepting/declining invitations, joining the project as a manager and so on should still work. For testing these features, please, create another project using https://connect.topcoder-dev.com/new-project/ link to interfere with other participants. Keep the existent example project as it is for the demo of various cases. 

General requirements

  • For styling use ONLY colors from the https://github.com/appirio-tech/tc-ui/blob/feature/connectv2/src/styles/_variables.scss. If some new color is introduced in design, please replace it with the closest one from the variables.

  • Avoid using multilevel nesting in SCSS. As we use CSS Modules we don’t have to add prefixes or nest class selectors.

  • Don’t use “:global” in CSS Modules unless you have to change some global styles. New styles shouldn’t use “:global”.

  • Reuse existent styles when possible.

  • Follow React and Redux best practices.

  • Follow the DRY principle.

  • Lint should pass (don’t disable eslint rules).

  • Existent unit tests should pass.

  • Git patch should be without errors or warnings.

Note

As Member Service where we get data about user details may have some issues on DEV, we temporary hardcoded the details for some users in case they are not returned. If for some users we don’t get any user details real or mocked, such users should be shown as “Connect User”, see screenshot.

If you have any questions or concerns, don’t hesitate to raise a question on the forum.

name: Topcoder Connect - Fix stickable sidebar
description:
Fix stickable sidebar when we expand/collapse something inside the sidebar.

Project Background

Topcode Connect is a client-facing application of Topcoder. In our layout, we have a sidebar next to the main content which is stickable (see demo video). Recently, we added buttons “Show All”/”Show Less” that show all project members or collapse them and show just a few of them which brokes the sticky sidebar behavior when the quantity of content inside the sidebar is changed.

  • SCSS

Code access

Individual requirements

When we click the buttons “Show All” the quantity of content in the sidebar grows and it got cut, see demo video. We have to scroll up and scroll down again to see the whole content of the sidebar.

Don’t call recalculation just every second or so on, as it most likely would lead to degradation of the performance.

The same things we have to fix when we click “Show Less” and the quantity of content shrinks which shows a big empty space in the bottom of the sidebar and it jumps when we start to scroll, see demo video (note, as we click “Show Less” in this demo video the second time - it works good).

name: Topcoder Project Service - Fix project data in DB
description:
Create an admin endpoint that would fix project data in DB to be indexed in Elastic Search.

Project Background

name: Topcoder Legacy Project Processor - Use Project Service API
description:
Use Project Service API instead of direct DB queries to manage “directProjectId”.

Project Background

Topcoder Project Service is the main backend service of Topcode Connect – the client-facing application of Topcoder. When we create a new project in Project Service we also create a project in another service called Topcoder Direct. Some time ago the code which did so was included in the Project Service source code, but in the new version of Project Service this code to manage Direct projects has been moved to a separate microservice called “Topcoder Legacy Project Processor”. Also, this new implementation uses direct access to the DB to update Project Service data. This causes some issues so we have to reimplement it “Topcoder Legacy Project Processor” to use Project Service API.

Technology Stack

  • Node.js

  • PostgreSQL

Code access

The work for this challenge has to be done in one repository:
- Project Service repo https://github.com/topcoder-platform/legacy-project-processor branch develop commit f123bcba00fffe1bb65eb6ad5bb250d94a689ab8 or later.
- You would have to start Project Service V5 locally for testing.

- Config for local setup is provided on the forum.

Individual requirements

Currently, we are directly calling PostgreSQL DB in 2 places, but shouldn’t do so and instead, we should call Project Service API to make the same operations:

  1. https://github.com/topcoder-platform/legacy-project-processor/blob/develop/src/services/ProcessorService.js#L508 - replace this query by calling Project Service API endpoint `GET {PROJECTS_API}/projects/{id}`, it would return also `directProjectId` which we need.

  2. https://github.com/topcoder-platform/legacy-project-processor/blob/develop/src/services/ProcessorService.js#L469 - replace this query by calling Project Service API endpoint `PATCH {PROJECTS_API}/projects/{id}` with body `{ directProjectId: <directProjectId>}`.

Implementation requirements

  • As we no longer call PostgreSQL DB directly, we should remove everything connected with it: all the npm dependencies and configuration related to the PostgreSQL, POSTGRES_URL, and sequelize.

  • To call Project Service API we need to obtain an M2M token. We can do this the same way we do in Project Service to call other services, see https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/v5-upgrade/src/util.js#L349
    - getting M2M would require us to define 5 more environment variables: AUTH0_CLIENT_ID, AUTH0_CLIENT_SECRET, AUTH0_URL, AUTH0_AUDIENCE, AUTH0_PROXY_SERVER_URL
    - create a new file ProjectService which would contain reusable methods to get project by id, and to update project. These methods should be used to replace DB queries mentioned above.
    - make Project Service base URL (PROJECTS_API) configurable by environment variable and with default value in config `http://localhost:8001/v5/`

General requirements

  • DON’T include the values for environment variables AUTH0_CLIENT_ID, AUTH0_CLIENT_SECRET, AUTH0_URL, AUTH0_AUDIENCE, AUTH0_PROXY_SERVER_URL inside the repository or git patch. These variables should always be configurable manually by setting environment variables.

  • Update README according to the changes:
    - remove everything connected to the PostgreSQL DB
    - add guide on how to setup env variables for M2M, but DON’T ADD the actual values provided on the forum

  • Keep all existing unit tests and update them accordingly. Unit tests should not use or mock DB anymore, and they may need to mock Project Service API calls if necessary.

  • Existent unit tests should pass.

  • Lint should pass (don’t disable eslint rules).

  • Git patch should be without errors or warnings.

Verification Video

Provide a verification video that would show how a new project in Project Service is created and after that it’s being populated by “directProjectId”.

Submission without verification video proving that it works, would not be reviewed.



Final Submission Guidelines

Submit a zip file which would include:

  • Git patch with changes you’ve made to the code in “legacy-project-processor” repository.

  • Text file with a link to the verification video, or video file.

Additionally, the winner would be required to raise a pull request to the repository after the challenge is completed.

name: Topcoder Connect - Fix DraftJS Line Disappear Issue
description:
Fix an issue in our WYSIWYG editor based on DraftJS with disappearing some lines during editing.

Project Background

Topcode Connect is a client-facing application of Topcoder. We have a text editor based on DraftJS to edit posts. It allows us both: enter text in markdown format or use WYSIWYG tools (bold, italic, bullet list and so on). We have some issues during editing which we would like to fix.

Technology Stack

  • React

  • DraftJS

  • SCSS

Code access

The work for this challenge has to be done in one repository:

- Connect App repo https://github.com/appirio-tech/connect-app branch master, commit ea720c968a6e9b7280f36743cc85f327139d351b or later.

- The user for testing is provided on the forum.

Individual requirements

There are two ways to reproduce the issue we have which are shown in the next demo video: https://monosnap.com/file/6OIfYorGVB1Ofm7tzmRWnH7cwTTB6X. Both of these issues you can see in the demo project https://connect.topcoder-dev.com/projects/8610/messages/34545 - please, DON’T change this project so everyone can see these issues, create a new project using link https://connect.topcoder-dev.com/new-project/prepaid_budget for testing.

To reproduce the issues create a new post with next content:

  1. First line: “- First line starts with dash and after press Enter”
    Second line: “      Second line starts with 6 spaces”
    - If we save such a post, and after click edit, then the second line would disappear during editing, but it should stay and we should be able to edit it.

  2. First line: “- First line starts with dash and after press Enter”
    Second line: “    Second line starts with 4 spaces”
    - Actually, in the second line, we can put from 2 until 5 spaces and reproduce the same issue.
    - If we save such a post, and after click edit, then the first line would disappear during editing, but it should stay and we should be able to edit it.

Important notes

  • If we entered some content it should never disappear. So the fix should work for already created posts with these issues.

  • How we show the content in “view” mode should be the same as how we see it when click “edit”. So if something is bullet list in “view” mode it should be bullet list in “edit” mode. If something is shown as “code” during “view”, it should stay as “code” during “edit”.

General requirements

  • Don’t break any existent features of the post editor.

  • The fix should be fixing the root of the issue and work for the whole class of issues, not only fixing the very particular case.

  • Follow React and Redux best practices.

  • Follow the DRY principle.

  • Lint should pass (don’t disable eslint rules).

  • Existent unit tests should pass.

  • Git patch should be without errors or warnings.

If you have any questions or concerns, don’t hesitate to raise a question on the forum.



Final Submission Guidelines

Submit a zip file which would include:

  • Git patch with changes you’ve made to the code in our repository.

Additionally, the winner would be required to raise a pull request to the repository after the challenge is completed.

name: Topcoder Project Service - Only list project with pending invites
description:
Fix request to Elastic Search to only list project with invites in “pending” status, but not “requested”.

Project Background

Topcoder Project Service is the main backend service of Topcode Connect – the client-facing application of Topcoder. We have an endpoint that returns the list of projects. For non-admin users, we return only projects which users are invited to or already members of. We have 2 status of active invites: “pending” and “requested”. “pending” status means that user has been invited and can see the project in the project list to be able to accept or decline the invitation. But “requested” status of invitation means that invite by itself is not yet approved by a special user, and in such case, users shouldn’t see projects where they have “requested” invite. Currently, users may list the projects if they have an invitation in any status.

Technology Stack

  • Node.js

  • ElasticSearch

Code access

The work for this challenge has to be done in one repository:
- Project Service repo https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service branch master commit 4b1bf7cc23dc5384f14b99afe8b7388709cb7367 or later.

- Config for local setup is provided on the forum.

Individual requirements

  • We have an endpoint to list the projects “GET /v5/projects”. 

  • When we get the list of projects from ES (Elastic Search Index) it should return only projects for non-admins users who are invited, if invitation status is “pending”. We also have a fallback request from DB which works correctly, see code.

  • Implement at least 2 unit tests:
    - `should return projects where a non-admin user has an invitation in “pending” status`
    - `should NOT return projects where a non-admin user has an invitation in “requested” status`

  • Hint. To create an invitation with `requested` status use manager user token and send a request to the “POST /v5/projects/{projectId}/members/invite/” endpoint with body `{"userIds":[40152855],"role":"copilot"}`.

General requirements

  • Existent unit tests should pass.

  • Lint should pass (don’t disable eslint rules).

  • Git patch should be without errors or warnings.



Final Submission Guidelines

Submit a zip file which would include:

  • Git patch with changes you’ve made to the code in our repository.

Additionally, the winner would be required to raise a pull request to the repository after the challenge is completed.

name: Topcoder Connect - Fix local time calculation
description:
Correctly show the local time and timezones UTC offset for the project members.

Project Background

Topcode Connect is a client-facing application of Topcoder. We are showing local time for the project members in the timezone of the members. For this purpose, we are using the static list of timezones and their UTC offsets, though it appears that this list doesn’t take into account daylight saving time of the timezones and other possible timezone peculiarities.

Technology Stack

  • React

Code access

The work for this challenge has to be done in one repository:

- Connect App repo https://github.com/appirio-tech/connect-app branch master, commit 445f0f100804012114a5f73ee8659ba7872db33b or later.

- The user for testing is provided on the forum.

Individual requirements

  • We are showing local time for the project members on the left sidebar, see screenshot and demo project.

  • At the moment we are using static list of timezones and their offsets which leads to issues like this which so far we quick fixed via the hardcoded value of the current UTC offset.

  • To fix such issues properly, we have to use a library that would correctly calculate the current UTC offset and current local time by the timezone. We prefer to use moment-timezone as we already using “moment” library.

  • Please, provide proof that all the timezones from our static list are supported by “moment-timezone” library, or provide a list of timezones that are not supported from our list if any. [required]

  • If some timezone is not supported by “moment-timezones” the code should fallback in such cases to our static list. [required]

General requirements

  • Follow React and Redux best practices.

  • Follow the DRY principle.

  • Lint should pass (don’t disable eslint rules).

  • Existent unit tests should pass.

  • Git patch should be without errors or warnings.

If you have any questions or concerns, don’t hesitate to raise a question on the forum.



Final Submission Guidelines

Submit a zip file which would include:

  • Git patch with changes you’ve made to the code in our repository.

  • A file that would show the proof that all the timezones are supported by the “moment-timezones” library, or the list of not supported timezones if any.

Additionally, the winner would be required to raise a pull request to the repository after the challenge is completed.
